$SOL  Latest Solana ETF Data Raises Questions üëÄ  Fresh numbers from Farside show an unusual pattern in Solana ETF flows, especially around 21Shares (TSOL):  üîπ Key Points:  Seed capital (111M for TSOL) is almost completely offset by cumulative outflows (-101.5M).  This is not typical ETF behavior, especially during a period of strong macro tailwinds and increasing institutional attention.  Meanwhile, Bitwise (BSOL) and Grayscale (GSOL) show steady inflows, contributing to a total +638M across all SOL ETFs.  üîπ What‚Äôs unusual?  In a normal ETF launch:  Seed capital is created to provide initial liquidity.  After that, AUM should grow with new inflows, not be drained close to zero.  Heavy outflows so early usually mean:  Authorized participants arbitraging NAV vs spot,  Liquidity rotation into a cheaper ETF,  Internal rebalancing,  Or simply data inconsistencies (which has happened before).  Yet the other SOL issuers aren‚Äôt showing the same pattern ‚Äî which makes TSOL stand out even more.  üîπ Market Context  Bitcoin ETFs see mixed flows, Ethereum ETFs show heavy rotation, but Solana remains one of the few with net positive inflows.  Macro tailwinds (rate cuts priced in, QE returning, banks adopting crypto rails) support risk-on assets ‚Äî making the TSOL pattern even more curious.  ‚ùì Open Question  Why is 21Shares' Solana ETF almost fully unwinding its seed position while competitors are accumulating?  Is this structural, strategic, or something else entirely?

The situation on Solana right now is pretty brutal for anyone hoping for a truly fair token launch, especially with $SOL  trading at $138.47 today after a solid +5% bounce.  
As soon as a new token adds liquidity on Raydium or any other DEX, sniper bots detect it instantly and buy up most of the supply in the same block, often within 1 or 2 seconds. Normal people using regular wallets and swapping through Jupiter or directly on the site simply can‚Äôt compete. By the time your transaction goes through, the price is already pumped 10-100x and 70-90% of the tokens are already in bot wallets.  

These bots run on private nodes, pay massive priority fees, and sometimes even bundle their buys with the liquidity addition itself, so they‚Äôre guaranteed to get in first. Devs and their inner circle usually get the real dip too, either through presale or by running the same bots.  

So unless you‚Äôre coding your own sniper, paying for bundle services, or you‚Äôre friends with the team, ‚Äúfair launch‚Äù on Solana in 2025 is honestly just a myth for retail traders. The chain is too fast and too open, the bots always win.
